metadata.title: CVE-2021-3826 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c inlibiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service(segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-arm-none-eabi - 15:12.2.rel1-1
gcc-arm-none-eabi-source - 15:12.2.rel1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gcc-11 package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15:12.2.rel1-1').
gcc-12 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.3.0-6ubuntu1').
gcc-13 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.2.0-1ubuntu1').
gdb package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.0.50.20230810-0ubuntu1').
binutils package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40-2ubuntu4').
